body.p: If you've played Cube and your Cube installation runs fine, then AssaultCube will too.

Minimum specs:
Processor: Pentium III 500 Mhz (or AMD equivalent).
Graphics: GeForce 1 / ATi Radeon or better.
Ram: 192 MB ram
Keep in mind these are the bare minimums, so you may need a lot of adjustment to get AssaultCube to run. We recommend that you run AssaultCube on better hardware than this.

Recommended GFX settings for low/medium end machines:
Resolution: 800x600@16bpp
Antialiasing: OFF
Anisotropic Filtering: OFF

Make sure you have these libraries installed:
libSDL 1.2
libSDL_image
libSDL_mixer
Appropriate OpenGL drivers (if they're not installed already)
Note: Settings for AssaultCube will be saved in the .assaultcube folder in your home directory.
You may find that you need to rename the file DbgHelp_RemoveThisPartIfOnWin98.DLL in your bin_win32 folder to DbgHelp.DLL for AssaultCube to work.

When you first start AssaultCube, you will be prompted to change some fundamental settings from their defaults to how you would like them. Some display settings can be changed here.
To change more display settings, press ESCAPE and then go: Settings > Video Settings.

If you are having technical problems and need to change settings in a way that doesn't start the game to do it, you can modify the batch/shell script by adding parameters into it. The different parameters can be found in command-line options.
Windows: Use the shortcut provided. Or execute the AssaultCube.bat file in your AssaultCube folder.
Linux: In a console, change your location (cd) to the main AssaultCube directory and then execute AssaultCube.sh.

In game, press ESC to access the main menu. From there you can do all sorts of actions, like joining multiplayer games and changing settings. As example, in the Team/Player Setup submenu, you can choose your team and skin.

The menu covers the most important actions. Further customizations and actions can be done using CubeScript: To get a console press T to open up the chat prompt. This will increase the size of your crosshair. Check the reference to see all gameplay relevant commands you can use through CubeScript.
Hint: Press F11 to get a bigger console history.

There is the file defaults.cfg in the config directory. If you run AssaultCube for the first time it will execute this file. Once you quit AssaultCube, the default settings and your changes on them will be stored to config/saved.cfg. If you want to reset your settings to the default values just delete it.
